page.title: 03Stansted Windmill.
page.content: The dominent feature of Stansted Mountfitchet is its{Windmill}which overlooks the village. In{1787}a{Millhouse,Malthouse}and {Villa}were built.Now the bakehouse and Villa have now been incorporated into an adjacent private dwelling.The Mill- house is now a Catholic Church.The Malthouse was destroyed by fire in 1877. During 1910 the Mill ceased to function and 30 years later severe storms damaged much of the building. In 1950 the Windmill was listed as an {Ancient Monument}and a{restoration {committee}was set up to undertake major repairs. In May 1985 Stansted's Windmill stands pround,having received its new sails. Stansted Mill remains one of the few complete surviving examples of what was once a familiar sight in Essex.
